intro: Strychnos scortechinii, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy aril. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is important to handle the plant with care.
